reviews.title: Great No-Fuss Fridge
reviews.review_text: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) We've had the Whirlpool WRT518SZFM refrigerator for two months now and we're very happy with it. It runs quietly, keeps everything cold, and we haven't had any issues. It's a basic model, but it does exactly what we need. We didn't add the ice maker, but that hasn't been a problem for us. Overall, a solid, no-fuss fridge that works well.

reviews.title: Perfect for our condo
reviews.review_text: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) Happy the minute they brought it into my kitchen Sleek Clean

reviews.title: Great product
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this refrigerator 2 weeks ago, and so happy with it! The 28" width was so perfect for a smaller kitchen, but packs so much storage and looks much bigger because of the added height! The freezer works so well compared to 2 previous refrigerators. It was unreal! And LOVE the storage and shelves. Great product! I got the black - super sleek

reviews.title: Good product for the price.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Had this for almost a month. The refrigerator portion is very spacious. The freezer is a little small. It needed to include a second shelf. We did not purchase the ice maker so we could have used an extra shelf. It fits our space nicely. (we have a small area for the refrigerator) The motor is a little loud but not loud enough for concern. We would buy it again.

reviews.title: Light bulb not designed to be replaced easily
reviews.review_text: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I like this refrigerator. It is the size we wanted, the door has a fair amount of storage, it is simple and does what we need it to. It isn't noisy per se, but it does make odd noises occasionally. My primary issue, and the reason I am giving 3 stars, is the lightbulb. I am assuming the intent is that the lightbulb will last the life of the fridge. Ours failed in less than a year. It is very difficult to replace this light bulb, and frustrating that it failed so early in the life of the fridge.

reviews.title: Not very happy
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've had the appliances a little over a month. Not very be with refrigerator, makes a lot of noise when it runs the freezer door hangs a little. Doesn't shut all the way, in the refrigerator door gets stuck so bad. I got to use two hands to rip it open

reviews.title: Poor design
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought about a month ago. Not very happy with this Whirlpool purchase. Inside is very poorly designed. Spacing on door shelves doesn't allow for anything over the height of a water bottle. The main refrigerator is not much better. Drawers are very flimsy. Not one of their better appliances.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The ice maker pours water onto the ice maker container and also inside of the freezer. The technician that came to change my doors from opening left opening right told me that the person who put the icemaker in put in the wrong adapting tube and it's too short to reach where the water is supposed to go.

reviews.title: Looks good but that's about all!
reviews.review_text: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) Whoever is in charge of quality control should be fired! Having the controls in the top front is a design flaw. I have never heard a more noisy fridge! Also seems to be running constantly. I am actually trying to sell it for a loss!

reviews.title: Cheap Cheap Cheap
reviews.review_text: Died after less that 2 years. Coolant disappeared. Thin thin thin metal with wires left touching the cooling coils. Should have bought the extended warranty. Will do with next purchase as I'd at least have gotten 5 years of service. Landfill.

reviews.title: Great Product!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this a few weeks ago and I don't have any issues with it. I returned the ice maker due to a plumbing issue and not because the ice maker was not working. The refrigerator looks great in my kitchen, had plenty of space and is very quiet. Love so far!

reviews.title: Great Chill
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this fridge 3 weeks ago & it exceeds my hopes. It's QUIET. The motor runs infrequently, probably because it's so well insulated. Moveable shelves allowed for fitting the fridge to my needs. Just wonderful!

reviews.title: Holds temperature perfectly.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Two thermometers in the freezer and refrigerator each. The door and back are the same and perfectly in range for each. The receded door handles are a pinch hazard, if you try to close the door with fingers outside the receded region. And it seems to run compressor more on than off. Wondering how much electricity is going to cost. Not ruining food is more important.

reviews.title: Replacing a 20+ year-old refrigerator
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like it. It looks so beautiful in my kitchen. I like how the shelves in the door accommodate the big fat bottles of Smartwater and the smaller half size shelves are great as they can hold anything from a bag of shredded cheese to a tall bottle of Worcestershire sauce with ease. I never used the crisper drawers in my former refrigerator and had even removed them to create another shelf. The crisper drawers that I am now using and love Work so well and keeping Produce fresh and for long periods of time.

reviews.title: Limited in space, I bought this 28" Whirlpool.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Actually, I would give this refrigerator 4 1/2 stars. I have room for a 30" frig but after endless searching (others' reviews and Consumer Reports) I chose this Whirlpool because my primary goal was to find a refrigerator that kept temperature. So far so good! Setting the temperature for the freezer and the refrigerator takes a bit of patience but for me the factory setting was a bit too cold and I dialed it down a notch. I also was cautious when I read about some models being noisy. I definitely didn't want that. As it is, this one isn't silent - the motor sound isn't loud but it does run at a rather high pitched tone (think a Tesla starting up). I love the deli drawer but miss having a butter keeper. All in all, given the options for my narrow space, I think I made the right choice.

reviews.title: Well Designed and Well Built
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This New Refrigerator is slightly smaller than our original one. It Holds More groceries than our Larger model! The Storage and Compartments are Fantastic. It is Very Well Designed and Gorgeous exterior. It keeps all our items Cold and Freezer is Perfect! Job well done by Whirlpool.

reviews.title: Lots of room for a small refrigerator
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's good. There's enough room in the refrigerator section - especially for such a small unit. But the freezer has no light in it. And I think that's ridiculous. I often come down at night to grab something from the freeze. And now I have to turn the light on in the room to see what's in the freezer. How much would it have cost them to put a bulb in the freezer?? Also there is no ice maker. That is annoying but does give me more room in the tiny freezer.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am happy with this refrigerator, but if I had it to do over again I'd never buy the silver door. It's impossible to get fingerprints off. It also runs pretty cold. I like the placement options for the shelves. It's much smaller than my last one, and the advantage is that it moves easily and I can clean under and behind it with no problems.

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So I've had my refrigerator since July 12th. I sent the first one back because of what I felt was a manufacture defect. The top was unleveled and the seal around the door was slightly damaged. I bought it brand new. Since receiving the second one I am much happier. The shelves feel awkwardly placed but I'm getting used to it. I love all the shelves in the door. I wish there was a light in the freezer. The last door shelf is kinda placed weirdly but I realize they were trying to make use of all space. I'm glad only the front is stainless steel. The sides are just a grey finish. Which match the grills on my white stove

reviews.title: Okay
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Okay for price paid. Finish work/glue a little sloppy. Also I was very very disappointed when it arrived with the R609a refrigerant. The model in stores have the older refrigerant which is why I bought it. I am know worried this one will not have a long life. My repair man says the refrigerant makes a difference. Fortunately I purchased the extended warranty this time.

reviews.title: Great replacement!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Our old refrigerator was over 20 years old so we needed to replace it and wanted something in stainless steel. We live in a row home and needed a smallish model. We are very happy with this model. Even though it isn't as wide as our old refrigerator there is still plenty of space for all our food, drinks, condiments and frozen items. We're very happy with our purchase.

reviews.title: Good deal
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've had my refrigerator now for a little over a month and I really like it. It's a little bit louder than my last refrigerator but I'm learning to deal with it it's not so loud that you can't concentrate. I was a little disappointed that there is no longer in egg compartment. I do however like that I can slide the deli drawer from side to side. I did notice it's getting harder to find refrigerators with the freezer on the top. I also noticed that the deli drawer is now an extra in a lot of refrigerators. This is the first time I've ever owned a nice maker and it's making more ice than I can use lol

reviews.title: Does what it says
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this refrigerator/freezer and icemaker as a replacement for one I purchased in 2021. It was replaced free under the 5-year warranty. I've only had this new one a few weeks, but it works as expected--keeps things cold in the frig and frozen in the freezer. The ice maker works well. The refrigerator looks just like the picture. No mars on the stainless finish. The men who put it in were very nice and cleaned up and took the old frig away.

reviews.title: Quality ?
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this 08/27/25 and received it on 09/03. It goes well with the other appliances in appearance and functionality. The grey sides and top are a nice relief from black and helps to lighten the kitchen a bit more. I would have given 5 stars if the top of freezer door and bottom of the fridge door had a finishing plug for the holes in the trim. That must be where the foam is injected into the doors. It looks and feels unfinished. Good insulating job because the foam shows at the seams where the black plastic trim meets the stainless steel. It looks good, sounds good, and has nice LED lighting.

reviews.title: Basically happy
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I did not purchase the model with the EZ connect icemaker. The refrigerator is spacious but should have another shelf. As for the freezer, it is disprortionately small.. It ran continuously for 24 hours but it finally stopped.

reviews.title: OK refrig but not recommended for a household
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] BE AWARE: Bought this rerig for our garage. Delivery and set up, take away of old refrig all went well. After waiting 24 hours to store food in refrig and freezer noticed freezer was coated with frozen ice droplets, wiped them up and next day same issue. Repair came and heated the seal on freezer. Better but still had frost/droplets across top of freezer. Second repairman came, called engineering who told him that the air flow is such in this refrig that when you open the refrig door, air pushes into the freezer and causes a small air gap in the freezer seal that cannot be fixed!! Suggested that everytime we open refrig to push freezer shut to avoid this issue. If you want to do this, ok. If not, offered to give me the cost of this refrig on purchase of another. As ours is not our main refrig and in the garage we opted to keep this refrig.

reviews.title: Nice small refrigerator!!!!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Owned it a couple weeks now, and overall am happy with my new fridge. Controls very easy to use, and maintains temperatures in the freezer section and fresh food section very well. Looks nice, too, very compact, sleek, easy to use. As a single man, it's all I need !! The door swing had to be changed from left to right, which I did myself, took about 30 minutes, easy to do. Complaints would be absence of a light in the freezer section, pretty dark in there!! And sometimes while running, the fridge emits a very low toned 'siren' sound while the compressor is running, but not all the time. Overall, for the price, it's a good buy.

reviews.title: Exterior is easy to clean.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We remodeled our kitchen and wanted stainless steel to match our stove. The Whirlpool fridge fit the bill and was priced right. It stays cold on auto setting. Keeps milk and other beverages very cold and that's the way we like it.

reviews.title: Great for small Kitchens
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Having a small kitchen made our choices for fridges limited.. this was a great choice. Inches feel like feet in a small kitchen and having a few inches back really helps. So far great fridge for the price.

reviews.title: Convinient storage
reviews.review_text: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I bought this fridge in May 2018, the inside is very convinient storage, the water and ice system doesn't take too much room in the fridge. My only complaint is the finger print on the front surface. I highly recommend you get the protection, I didn't and I regret it.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased my 28 inch Whirlpool refrigerator on April 29. It is so vety quiet that I hardly ever hear it. It is very basic with the freezer on top and frig on the bottom, which is exactly what I wanted. There is no ice maker or water feature, which is perfect for me. I love the fact that the handles are built in, so the entire front is flat. It is black and matches my stove and also my notty pine kitchen. I am extremely happy with my new refrigerater!!

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Once I moved the shelves to where they worked best for my needs, I have liked it. Changed from a larger side by side with an ice maker to a smaller refrigerator with no ice maker. Having to adjust to a smaller freezer.

reviews.title: Good size for 2nd refrigerator
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The one I had exactly like this one the light switch on door broke. The repairman said he was unable to replace it because he couldn't get to the wiring above the switch inside. It quit working totally. I bought the same kind again because I liked the design and size for that space.

reviews.title: Extra large freezer fit into same small space.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Older frig stopped at inopportune time for December. Temps oddly at 70 degrees for few days then dropped to freezing. Lost all of my food and freezer contents. Now happier tho with the new Whirlpool upgrade and love the larger freezer on top. Unexpected delight with decision. Thanks.

reviews.title: Just what we needed!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We needed to replace a refrigerator that was 36 years old, still running, but figured it was time for a new one. The price was incredible, the look of it is slick, (I hadn't planned on buying a silver one, but I now love it!) Its a little smaller than the one we had previously, but since its just the 2 of us, its great and oh so quiet! So far so good!

reviews.title: Beautiful but requires constant care
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It works well. The only complaint I have is that this stainless steel appliance, unlike my others, is not fingerprint resistant. It requires cleanup & buff after most meals to remain looking its very best which I do. Otherwise the fingerprints take "center stage" for all to see. Although it is very pretty and I liked the glass shelves & drawers layout, had I known about the fingerprint issue I would probably have shopped around a little more.

reviews.title: Great fridge!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've had this refrigerator for a couple of months and am very happy with my purchase. While Whirlpool was not my first choice, I am so glad I checked it out at the store cause it's exactly what I was looking for... the size is perfect for where I needed it to fit, it's clean lines, no fuss, silent. basic & roomy for all my needs. I purchased the icemaker separately. Everything worked out great!

reviews.title: Great looking small refrigerator!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a nice Fridge. Comming from a dual French Door KitchenAid (wonderful until it dies after 10 years), this is very small compared to that BUT it is quiet and quite functional. We especially like the horizontal sliding drawer in the fridge section. Also purchased the optional OEM ice maker. It takes up 12 inches in the freezer section. It was VerY EASY to install using the provided accessories. Makes tons of ice overnight. As for appearance, the entire unit has a great looking profile for what it is. Overall, I like to call this a "modern, old school refrigerator". We expect this to last a very long time. If you like bells and whistles though....this ain't it.

reviews.title: Great refrigerator for the price!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The refrigerator inside is very roomy and the positions of the organizers are great due to the fact you can move them to accomodate your food and drinks. Unfortunately, what seems to be a major issue is the fingerprints on the outside door. So this is something I have to clean everyday until I find something to keep the fingerprints from showing so much.

reviews.title: Great but ..
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the fridge it fits well in my small spot and gives me the majority of features that improve from my previous refrigerator. But it has a known issue where the top freezer door pops when you close the main fridge door ... like OMG, the

reviews.title: Perfect fit in many ways
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It fits very nicely in the space I had. Compact yet spacious inside. Clean sleek design. The doors were easy to reverse to allow access from the right side rather than the left. It keeps cool and frozen items at optimum temperatures and runs very quiet. I am quite pleased with this purchase.

reviews.title: Door not fully set up to reverse
reviews.review_text: The door is not exactly reversible. I don't know, I think your guy that does that part of the build went home early that day. My guy had to drill the holes in the top as only the metal was predrilled. The bolts that hold the middle plate in are all different sizes. We didn't notice and only moved one, to which the little cover fit but the cover didn't fit the bolt we didn't move (see photo). If you had have built the fridge properly, we could have changed door orientation in about a 1/2 hour, but because you did not build the fridge properly, it took almost two hours to change door orientation, and weren't sure what we were doing. And yes, my guy is experienced in this, and also yes, we tried to follow your inadequate instructions.

reviews.title: Excellent room
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This refrigerator seems to have more interior room than my previous refrigerator which measured as larger. I am very pleased with the layout. The preferred chill setting seemed to be to warm so I turned it up to my only option. Now things are somewhat colder than I wanted. I would like for there to have been more variability in the temperature control but I understand that this one is a more basic model.

reviews.title: Nice finish & fairly quiet
reviews.review_text: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) So far I'm pretty happy with this refrigerator other than the interior light becoming dimmer next morning and that the controls should be at back of the fridge so that they're not in the way when you try to put items on the top shelf or remove them. The fridge does have a nice finish and is not very noisy which is great.

reviews.title: Door problems
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The door shelf fell off and broke within the first month. That never happened with my old frig, a Kenmore which was great for 15 years. I also had to exchange the first refrigerator delivered for a new one because the door would quickly swing wide open when opened if you didn't hold onto it. The replacement was better.

reviews.title: Great features
reviews.review_text: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I love my new refrigerator. I love the sliding cold cuts bin and the way the left vegetable bin pulls out. Also I had a spill and the way the vegetable bin shelf is designed the spill stayed on the shelf. The only negative comment I would make is that I thought the glass shelves were rather thin, but I put a liner on them and they are perfect now. Thank you Whirlpool for a great refrigerator.

reviews.title: Perfect Size and Great Performance!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] absolutely love this refrigerator! It's the perfect size for my kitchen and fits neatly into the space I had available. The inside layout is very thoughtful â€” the adjustable shelves make it easy to organize all my groceries, and the freezer has plenty of space too. It keeps everything cold and fresh without any issues. I also appreciate how energy-efficient it is, and it's much quieter than I expected. Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable, well-made fridge!

reviews.title: An Excellent Upgrade
reviews.review_text: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) While the pandemic greatly delayed our receipt of the fridge, it has exceeded all of our expectations. It is deep and fits a lot more food than I thought it would. The top drawer can be moved which is an exciting feature as we are able to adjust it to fit various sizes of food depending on our needs. The freezer is well structured to maximize the space and I am very excited to look into the attachable ice maker.

reviews.title: Great for our smaller need
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for our little kitchenette downstairs. Everything working well. Recommended temp is more than enough to keep beverages cold. First one came damaged but was resolved quickly. Great item for the price

reviews.title: Great features!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A fantastic refridgerator for its size and cost. It has large bins in the side door, some of which can hold a gallon size of milk. Both the freezer and refridgerator doors open and close with ease and also swivel more than 270 degrees making it easy to load and retrieve items.

reviews.title: Not so great
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Had this delivered twice. First time the freezer seal bounced open every time the fridge closed and didn't get cold enough. Replacement still has the freezer issue but a least it colder than the first one.

reviews.title: Good value for the price
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We have a small space, and we're happy this fifth of space. I like the adjustable shelves, and all of the storage space in the door of the fridge. It does how constant heavy noise, but most of the time I don't even notice it

reviews.title: New fridge
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice looking unit seems to work fine. I like the finish and I like the height of it. Did not get the optional ice machine I might get the icemaker later. I can't find the freezer light does not seem to have a light inside the freezer that's rather inconvenient. I never bother checking figured they all came with. seems to pick up fingerprints but it does clean easy certainly worth the investment.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Not a bad little refrigerator, keeps a constant overall cold. No freeze spots. My only complaint is I purchased a no fingerprint stainless and it is smudged and "scared" stainless, now. Switching the door swing was quite a challenge but we did manage it. I am a big Whirlpool fan, this being the only size available, overall I am happy with my frig.

reviews.title: Glad I purchased
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I replaced my old refrigerator last month with this new Whirlpool. I was afraid that it would be so much smaller, but it has ample storage and the food racks on the door are designed not to spill items that are smaller, (an issue with my previous refrigerator). Also, it is very quiet compared to my other fridge.

reviews.title: Very happy with our Whirlpool
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We have had our Whirlpool refrigerator since March 1 and are very pleased with it. it has a sleek look, and does not show fingerprints. It is the right size for our kitchen and holds enough food for the two of us plus grandchildren who are always hungry when they come after school to visit. The temperature for both fridge and freezer are perfect.

reviews.title: Mediocre
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Refrigerator is noisy. The loudest Refrigerator I've owned. I have placed thermometers in the refrigerator and the top freezer. The refrigerator maintains a good temperature. But the top freezer struggles to get down to 15 degrees fahrenheit.

reviews.title: User manual and refrigerator comments
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Refrigirator light flickers from on-off-on every few days.Why does it flicker? Page 4 of user manual - "Remove the light shield (if applicable) as shown below" is not defined sufficiently enough. How to replace it with such information? All of us reacted to high frquency pitch sound. Not enough information how to clean dirt from rear heat exchanger in user manual. No nformation on defrosting the freezing compartment and how often. User manual poorly written. Model # sticker has small fonts hard to read without magnifier. No informationon why the refrigerator cooling stays on for hours, I assume it must use less power.

reviews.title: Love it!!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've had my new refrigerator since January and love it!! Only had so much room so harder to find. I love everything about it, very quiet, love the look of it. Had my old Whirlpool for 22 years, actually still working in my garage. I have other Whirlpool appliances and love them all.

reviews.title: Function and attractive unit
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just purchased 3 weeks ago, have not had any issues. Fairly roomy for a smaller condo fridge, looks nice as well. I wish the fridge door closed more gently though like the freezer door does. Every thing is adjustable, I like the can rack on door too.

reviews.title: Very annoying motor/compressor noises
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this to replace our last Whirlpool refrigerator, and an all frig/no freezer type wasn't an option anymore. I don't know if it's because of the self defrost freezer, but the motor is very noisy and has a high pitched, undulating whine that is very annoying. We don't have much other than some popsicles and ice cube trays in the freezer, so don't understand the extra noise that sometimes runs for 20 mins, quits for a bit, then starts up again.

reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So far so good! Taking some time to adjust to the different arrangement of shelves and bins. Refrigerator is so much quieter than my 41 year old unit. I expect this one will outlast me! I had a space where the old one fit perfectly, and the measurements for this new one were right on and it slid right in.

reviews.title: Works fine. Careless finishing.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this as a second fridge. Everything works fine. Some lack of detail in finishing docks a star. Spray foam insulation oozing out. Plastic protective wrap where you can't remove it all leaving ragged edges showing.

reviews.title: Nice compact fridge
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] An old backup fridge in the garage gave out. We purchased this product as its replacement. So far, we are quite happy with it. Even though its outside footprint inside large, it holds a fair amount and keeps things cold.

reviews.title: It keeps the temperatures very well.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A good refrigerator but has a very small freezer space. I made an additional half shelf on the top one to give more room. Also hard to keep items for going all the way to the back. You really have to watch out not to obstruct the airflow Drawer under the middle shelf is not very functional. Is by far not deep enough to store much. The handgrip takes too much space away and knocks items over that stand in front oof the drawer. It gives a false sense of being able to store taller items there (in front) than what is possible. No icemaker thank goodness, would even have given less space.

reviews.title: Had to go smaller cubicle feet
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm loving the glass shelves and adjustable shelves on the door.The slider drawer is perfect and depending on the space I need I can change the location of it.The freezer space is small with wasted space in the back wall because of the design.

reviews.title: Nice little refrigerator
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a nice refrigerator. A little smaller than the one we had previously. The cheese drawer needs to be deeper, but we have a lot of cheese. The only issue I have is perhaps when the installers switched the door orientation, they may not have gotten the freezer seal correct as there is a build up of ice now in the freezer. I really like that the cheese drawer slides from side to side. I am troubled that the replacement shelves are so expensive.

reviews.title: Great refrigerator
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a replacement for our second refrigerator. Delivery and set up was excellent. I left the settings on the recommended number and this refrigerator has performed flawlessly. I checked the reviews prior to purchase and was impressed with them especially from landlords that have used these for years. So far very satisfied with this purchase. Thank you.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my first Whirlpool purchase. It meets my needs, but it seems to be running more than my previous refrigerator. I called the local dealer about it, and they sent out a technician to be certain it was set up correctly. The tech verified it was set properly. I live alone, so there is minimum opening and closing of the fridge, and yet I hear it operating more than I would expect. Perhaps that is just the way it works.

reviews.title: Trust the negative reviews
reviews.review_text: Review all the negative reviews if you are thinking about buying this junk. The positive reviews likely are just Fluff for sales. The quality is very very low. The US factory this was manufactured/assembled in makes it impossible to remove the protective plastic. Its put on prior to assembly so the plastic is imbedded in all the connecting parts. Also has the internal insulating foam coming out of every crack and space it can on the outside sides, back, and doors. If you are thinking of buying this junk, just make sure you check all the negative reviews and know they are true, Like I said its very likely all the positive reviews are Whirlpool's fluff, the negative reviews will give you a better picture of the fridge to make a decision.

reviews.title: Do not like this fridge.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] There is little to like about this fridge other than it fits in a small space, so there's hardly any choices. It's not that quiet, it feels much smaller than my previous fridge which was a GE that finally broke after 20 years. To fit tall things you can only use 4 of the 5 door inserts. It's small and they decided that the back 3 inches don't matter as they are lost with weird shaped shelves that don't let you use the back of the fridge. The freezer vents take up the entire back wall so you can't put anything against the back or you cover up the vents. And, the smudging on the stainless steel is endless and impossible to keep clean so it's also hideous.

reviews.title: Didn't work right from the start.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Unfortunately we got a dud of a refrigerator I specifically went with Whirlpool because they were supposed to be quiet. Not quiet at all. When it runs it sounds like the toilet is running, and it runs constantly. The freezer also doesn't freeze well. Only to 10 degrees no matter what setting it is on. Not acceptable, it is recommended that a freezers optimal temperature is zero degrees. We have to now get a replacement. I would recommend a warranty program at any cost so you aren't waiting for a repair.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Freezer still not sealing correctly. Was difficult to get the service people out because they kept changing my service date. Once he came out he tried to fix the seal on the freezer but that did not work.

reviews.title: Fridge is NOT cold, Freezer is NOT freezing.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We bought a brand new Whirlpool Refrigerator-Freezer. Freezer will NOT freeze the ice trays after a week. I set the temp controls in freezer AND fridge to their coldest settings. Refrigerator cavity is hardly getting cold either. I think we have a lemon that needs to be replaced.

reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We bought this small fridge for overflow from our large kitchen one. We needed extra space for primarily frozen goods and extra milk, eggs, etc. We are very pleased with the small outer dimensions yet reasonable space inside.

reviews.title: Worth the price and then some
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this in November, and so far extremely happy. It suffered a minor ding in transit, but nothing that is of any concern. The inside seems huge compared to the smaller fridge we had been using. The shelves and doors storage pockets all adjust easily and give plenty of flexibility on storing refrigerated items.

reviews.title: Seriously! No freezer light!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] How cheap can a company get! The refrigerator is okay. It runs too often and is a bit noisy. Although it does keep good temperature so far But how cheap would it have been to install a light in the freezer. All other companies have them. It's a pain to have to put the kitchen light on when dark just to grab a frozen snack. Seriously Whirlpool!! How thoughtless. It's the little details that makes a company better. They make their product more user friendly to the consumer.

reviews.title: Somewhat disappointing.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was surprised to discover that there is no continuous temperature control, just four separate buttons about ten degrees apart. Storing insulin at any of the settings is not safe so I have to keep it in our other refrigerator. Not practical for people with only one frig.

reviews.title: Fridge is good but Freezer doesn't operate well
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this one last month. It's small and compact. Looks nice. Few issues I encountered. It seems those issues were there before like 3-5 years back and haven't been fixed. The main issue I found is the freezer. It does not freeze properly. All the ice creams are soft and near melted. Have to throw away all the frozen food because it was not frozen state after one day as it should. Remember all this is happening now, in winter. What will the situation in summer you can imagine. I changed the temperature setting to coldest to increase the airflow to the freezer but nothing changed. It appears the fridge COOLS the freezer. Freezer does not have its own mechanism to work and freeze the stuff. The fridge works well but not the above freezer portion. One more thing is about packing. The white padding is not easy to remove. Its till shows on the edges on door. It's kind of inserted into the gaps around door.

reviews.title: Brand new refrigerator , repair needed 45 days in
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Stopped cooling after 45 days. Whirlpool service came out to repair , found fan stopped running due to improper installation. This caused the freezer to ice up. Repair tech reinstalled and seems to be working now for the last 12 days normally. Whirlpool local support guy was awesome!

reviews.title: So far, so good!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am very happy with my new refrigerator. I had the same size (Different maker) before, but it seems like I can fit a lot more food and such in it. It seems to be the perfect temperature in both the refrigerator and freezer, and I like that it doesn't take much effort to close the doors. Bonus: my magnets stick!

reviews.title: Great storage at a reasonable price
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The refrigerator has a great deal of room. It comes temperature preset that works for me. I am using the refrigerator for extra food storage. There's plenty of room for oranges my husband uses to make fresh orange juice. Dishes for family meals can be prepared and stored without crowding our main refrigerator.

reviews.title: Freezer door does not close itself; you can lose f
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Refrigerators have been made for over 75 years. They are expected to have basic features . One important feature is that doors close automatically when they are pushed. This happens as intended with the refrigerator door. The magnet sucks it closed. This DOES NOT happen with the freezer door. It stops about an inch from closure. It appears to be made this way, as the sides of the door meets resistance of the sides of the freezer. It appears not to be any blockage. It will close when given a push. But user having to push a refrigerator door closed is not what refrigerator users have had to do for the last 75 years, and the dozens of other refrigerators we have lived with. We have already lost one freezer-full of food that thawed. This is not acceptable.

reviews.title: Doesn't work
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently bought this refrigerator and I'm having problems with the temperature and I have it on the recommended settings the freezer goes up and down ranging from 20 degrees to 30 degrees I can't freeze anything any the refrigerator goes from 32 degrees to 40 degrees. Do I have a serviceman coming here on Thursday and hopefully tell me what's wrong and if it can't be fixed then I'm requesting a new refrigerator it's still under warranty

reviews.title: This fits our space and I love it!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really love this refrigerator and am glad our old one quit working! Because our house is over 40 years old, the space in the kitchen is smaller than the standard current-day refrigerator measurements. This model was the only one on the floor that fit our requirement for depth and width, but was actually bigger than our old one because the height could fit in our space. I love the big bins (4 of them!) on the door of the fridge compartment that let me organize various spaces for sauces, salad dressing bottles, jellies, and butter, as well as the two long railed shelves that I haven't even filled up yet! I was a little nervous about some of the negative reviews I had seen on this model but so far the fridge is running perfectly with both fridge and freezer thermometers I had put in there showing it's doing perfectly. I hope it lasts a long time!

reviews.title: Stainless Problem
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We don't like the fact that every mark shows up on the stainless steel, and if you wipe it with soap and water and dry it, you can always see exactly where you wiped it. The stainless on our Frigidaire was much better, and I have always had Whirlpools.

reviews.title: I love the frig, but the issue must get resolved.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] There are a couple pieces missing in the frig that vents the air from the freezer. I called Whirlpool. They couldn't determine the missing pieces & scheduled an appointment with an authorized repairman, but they can't figure it out either. They were going to research but have yet to get back to me. I purchased an ice maker, but the hole in the back for the line is not bored out, so they couldn't install it. I'm ok with no ice maker, but the venting issue must get resolved. I am disappointed that Whirlpool has not reached out to resolve this. I'm sure they're aware that the technician did not fix it.

reviews.title: Terrific Fridge!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am very happy with the purchase of this refrigerator! It is the perfect size for a condo kitchen. I love that there are no protruding handles on the door. The refrigerator operates with barely a sound. I have no issues with the fridge or freezer doors shutting with little effort. The shelves are sturdy, well-made and easily adjustable. Highly recommend!
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I Purchase this refrigerator about a month ago and I've been very happy with it. It has enough storage that I need and it looks good in my house.

reviews.title: Crummy customer support
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought one month ago and the freezer door doesn't seal. We had to call support for our brand new unit and they missed the first appointment. We have since had two different techs come out. The freezer isn't fixed yet. I miss my fridge from 1990

reviews.title: The WORST- do NOT purchase Whirlpool Appliances!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased NEW refrigerator in March 2024 for a kitchen renovation. Plugged it up, it seemed to work. Began storing food in fridge and freezer. Food began spoiling quickly and meat did not freeze. Adjusted temperature several times and noticed no positive change. Called Whirlpool, scheduled technician from Jaybee's Appliance Repair for end of May 2024. Technician stated that refrigerator was USED. Due to how screws were placed in sockets in freezer, it suggests someone had tinkered with appliance before. I stated it was supposed to be brand NEW. Technician stated that the fan motor is out as well in this "brand new" refrigerator. He takes the part with him stating he's going to order a new one. I left him know I travel for work, so ensure to call me to confirm date and time for installation of new part. Two weeks past, I have not heard from tech. I called the number listed on service order. He answered and stated that there is no ETA on part, but he will call me when it comes in. A week goes by, then another, I called him again. No answer. Called Whirlpool customer service- Deanna calls him, he answers for CS Deanna, and tells agent that he still does not have ETA on part. Agent tells me to call him myself one more time to discuss. I tried and no answer. Another week goes by, I called Jaybee's, no answer, I called Whirlpool CS-Tim, called tech, he answered Tim, and tech told Tim that there is an unknown ETA, etc. STILL NOTHING IS DONE BY WHIRLPOOL OR TECHNICIAN. Another week goes by, I called Jaybee's for update, no answer. I called Whirlpool CS- I got a young woman who's name starts with an R. She stated that the work order was completed. I asked how can it be completed when Jaybee still has my fan motor out of my "new" refrigerator? She called him, and he stated that he had ordered the part but cancelled because I was not home and he could not reach me. Jaybee's Appliance Repair LIED. Never did anyone call me regarding an ETA of part or to confirm a time and date to install new part. "R" told me that she has to reschedule Jaybee to come back out to my home since he took the part before we can do anything else like schedule a different repair company. She scheduled it for Friday, June 28th. On that Friday, Jaybee called me before normal operating business hours (before 8am). I missed that call as my phone is on sleep mode until 8am. I called back twice, no answer. Jaybee had cancelled my work order and stated in note that he attempted to contact me. Jaybee did not leave a voicemail. And to note all the previous weeks that I called him, I could not leave a vm b/c his vm was not set up. Anyway, I called Whirlpool CS, Vonnie, told me that it would have to be rescheduled again. She told me Jaybee's operating hours are from 6am-2pm, and he'd be rescheduled for Monday, July 1. I received confirmed email of work order outlining that date and 6am-2pm operating work hours. Today is July 1, I have been prepared since 6am to receive a call from Jaybee. I received no call by 1pm, so I called Whirlpool. Apparently, Jaybee cancelled the work order for today and changed it to tomorrow. CS called him, and he stated that he sent me notification of change but wasn't sure if my number was working or if I'd checked my email. My phone is usually right beside me or attached to my hand- I check emails and texts frequently. There were NONE from Jaybee's notifying me of anything. So I wasted a whole day waiting for Jaybee! The CS agent told me that when he made the change it does not generate in the Whirlpool system because he changed it from his company's end. I requested that the CS agent send me a new email for confirmation as proof. She stated she couldn't do that but could send a text message confirming that Jaybee will come tomorrow between 9am-12pm to install new part. Test message was received. We will see if he comes tomorrow and if he truly repairs appliance because I do not trust Jaybee as he does not communicate and lies. Jaybee's Appliance Repair and Whirlpool Appliances are the worst. This is bad business on both their parts. I will NEVER purchase or recommend a Whirlpool appliance or Jaybee's Appliance Repair to anyone. This has been the worst experience going on 3 months now... absolutely ridiculous. P.S.- the doors are not sealed well. One must always look at the doors to ensure they're shut. The appliance overall is JUNK and is manufactured poorly. Just don't purchase a Whirlpool appliance, even if it's free, do not take it!

reviews.title: Hard to regulate the temperature

reviews.review_text: Purchased this model in May and was very pleased with its operational noise level. 4 months later several performance issues started, most notably loud whining, whirling, and grinding noises that eventually were â€œguesstimatedâ€ by the service company in consultation with the Whirlpool Sr. Tech appeared to be caused by a faulty evaporator motor. Result: the replaced evaporator motor sounds louder than the original one and the odd noises have resumed (albeit at a lower level), all which according to the Service Tech are normal. Seriously? Maybe in a cheap brand, not definitively a Whirlpool product. DO NOT recommend at all.

reviews.title: Very Disappointed with This Refrigerator
reviews.review_text: I purchased this refrigerator three years ago, and I have been facing persistent issues with the freezer. Recently, it stopped freezing altogether, resulting in the loss of a lot of food, which is especially frustrating in today's world. To make matters worse, I discovered that I am not covered under the limited warranty, which is disappointing for an appliance of this price. You would expect a longer warranty or better reliability from a product in this range. I do not recommend this refrigerator to anyone! If you're considering a purchase, I advise you to look elsewhere, horrible!

reviews.title: Buy Earplugs Too!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We bought this refrigerator a month ago without doing any research because the old one that came with our house had started making very loud growling noises. We have bought other Whirlpool appliances over the last year and are very happy with them but we won't keep this fridge. It's very, very noisy for a new fridge. What will it sound like a few years from now? Whirlpool claims it's normal, functioning as expected. My husband wants to take a sledge hammer to it. We will give it to charity and buy a competing brand. Other than the noise, it functions well and we like the amount of space for a smaller unit. Shelf organization and lighting are good.

reviews.title: Freezer door has very poor seal
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We've only had this refrigerator for two weeks but we're already seeing a problem with how easily the freezer door pops open every time the lower refrigerator door closes. The magnetic seal for the freezer door needs to be much stronger. I can't believe this is a new problem for this particular refrigerator and should have been fixed in testing of the product. Very disappointed in this flaw.

reviews.title: Poor quality for a Whirlpool product
reviews.review_text: Basic refrigerator and no frills which I knew going into the purchase. I did not expect the craftsmanship to be as poor as it is. All of my home appliances are whirlpool and this is the first one I am disappointed with. Multiple areas that should have caps are left without showing exposed cut raw metal, styrofoam, and insulation. Protective plastic wrap that covers the stainless steel during manufacturing and transportation is trapped between edges and looks poor. Also several tiny holes throughout the inside walls with tiny insulation foam poking out and silicone clumps in edges. Functional it works fine but cosmetically it's a mess. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

reviews.title: Fits My Needs
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have had this refrigerator for 10 days now and so far I am happy with the purchase. I had read other reviews and was a little concerned. But I have not experienced the problems that some report. Either it's just luck of the draw or they have since fixed the issues that could be fixed. I replaced a 22 year old refrigerator of the same size that still worked and wanted to replace it before it gave out. The new refrigerators configuration of the shelves is much better and while not quiet it's actually less noise than my previous refrigerator. The doors seal good and close easily keeping both freezer and refrigerator cold. I was worried on the first day because it was running constantly but the next morning it was cycling on and off with plenty of off time. The doors are stainless steel and look great but they do finger print easily. I have been opening and closing with the recessed pocket handles to prevent this. This is a good low price and size for 1 person or a second refrigerator but a family would need a larger size. I didn't get the ice maker and have not experienced frosting in the freezer. Hopefully my experience will remain for another 22 years ðŸ™

reviews.title: Cold Beverages
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This fridge is our secondary unit as it provides more cold storage than the kitchen fridge. In the AZ warm weather it's nice to have more area for cold beverages. The only issue is that the levelers don't work as well as they should which causes the doors to swing closed faster/harder than I want - still working to remedy the issue as the onboard levelers have been retracted to the maximum.

reviews.title: Good Service
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I originally purchased my first refrigerator in February. There was a problem with the freezer compartment resulting in an excessive buildup of ice. Whirlpool replaced the refrigerator with a new one.The doors on the is one have an excellent seal and I have no further issues. The only thing I dislike about the refrigerator is the light placemen, there is no freezer light and there are several attachments located at the top of the refrigerator compartment that take up a lot of space. These seem to have no purpose.

reviews.title: Happy, butâ€¦..
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was a reasonably priced fridge that fit into the available space in an older home. It would have been nice to have a freezer light. But the LED lighting in the fridge is great. Good temperature control with the fridge around 34-36 and the freeze at zero or minus 7. My one complaint is the fingerprint resistant feature of this stainless steel model. Seems like this surface spawns fingerprints and smudges. I also don't like the idea of being steered into buying the SS cleaner in the accessory section.

reviews.title: Lots of space inside for a small kitchen!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very nice stainless fridge for a small space. The interior is uncluttered to begin with and most of the storage bins can be removed, freeing large spaces inside. We needed this to replace an old fridge in our preschool kitchen and it is perfect.

reviews.title: Keeps my food fresher, longer. Great door storage!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It seems like it keeps my food fresher, longer. I also like that it doesn't come with an ice maker, but that the ice maker can be added later. Because it is deeper than my last refrigerator, it holds more food too. What I like best about it is all the storage space in the door. My last fridge had a butter shelf, that took up half the width of the top. Then, it only had 1 other 'shelf' beneath that. This has 3 full 'shelves' in the door, and I like how the top 2 shelves are divided in 2 - length wise. It's very helpful. A few small quibbles. The freezer top shelf doesn't go all the way to the back, so small items can fall to the lower level. Also, when removing the wrap from the front door - the only part of the fridge with stainless steel - it's almost impossible to get it all out of the area on the top of the fridge that it attached to. It scratches fairly easily, too, so it would be nice if a stainless steel wipes packet would be included with the fridge. But, I'm overall very happy. I don't know that I'd get a stainless steel again, but I would definitely buy this model again, maybe in black so it doesn't show dirt. White fridges show dirt. Stainless steel fridges scratch. I think my next fridge, which hopefully won't be for 13 more years, will be black.

reviews.title: Inexpensive refrigerator, get what you pay for.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this small refrigerator as a downsize. No bells and whistles. The problem is the freezer door does not close tight. And just closing the refrigerator door causes the freezer door to loosen. The seal on the freezer door is weak. Other than that it's an inexpensive refrigerator, get what you pay for.

reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As a basic refrigerator it does the job. Still getting used to the top freezer. Wife says it is still noisy.

reviews.title: Good features.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like my new refrigerator once Brian from Whirlpool came and leveled it and fixed the icemaker just in time to celebrate our birthday party for 7. He was great!
